node.title: China joins Russia in opposing NATO expansion
node.description: China has joined Russia in opposing further NATO expansion as the two countries move closer together in the face of Western pressure.

node.title: Snowboard rivals ready to chase Olympic medals
node.description: New Zealand snowboarder Zoi Sadowski-Synnott laying down challenge to American champion at Winter Olympics.

node.title: Winter Olympics officially open
node.description: The Beijing Winter Games are open, marking the start of an Olympics whose preparations were beset by the Covid-19 pandemic and criticism over human rights in China.

node.title: Accused killer on FBI's "Ten Most Wanted Fugitives" list captured in Mexico
node.description: Octaviano Juarez-Corro is accused of killing two people and wounding three others after allegedly opening fire at a Memorial Day picnic in Milwaukee in 2006.

node.title: Suspect arrested after San Francisco 49ers fan assaulted outside of L.A. stadium
node.description: Alexis Cifuentes, 33, was arrested and charged with felony assault.

node.title: Māpuna : RNZ's new programme showcasing Māori from across Aotearoa
node.description: Listen: RNZ National is today launching a magazine-style show called Māpuna which will be hosted by acclaimed broadcaster Julian Wilcox (Ngāpuhi, Te Arawa).

node.title: Temper expectations of Covid-19 impacted athletes
node.description: Fans need to show compassion if athletes fail to meet expectations when they return after a Covid-19 impacted build-up, says physio.

node.title: Draft order would have had DHS seize voting machines
node.description: CBS News obtained a copy of the draft order, "Presidential Findings to Seize, Collect, Preserve and Analyze National Security Information Regarding the 2020 General Election."

node.title: Ukraine tensions: US alleges Russian plot to fake invasion pretext
node.description: One option Russia is said to be considering is to stage and film a fake attack, with graphic images of an explosion showing numerous casualties. Russia says it's not planning anything.

node.title: In a provocative choice, China picks an athlete with a Uyghur name to help light the cauldron.
node.description: The pick seemed intended to answer criticisms of China’s mass detention and re-education campaign targeting Uyghur Muslims in the western region of Xinjiang.

node.title: Stuart Highway to reopen to trucks and emergency vehicles
node.description: The Stuart Highway will reopen to trucks and emergency services vehicles at 7am tomorrow, restoring the main road link between South Australia and the Northern Territory.

node.title: Biden labels IS leader's final act one of 'desperate cowardice'
node.description: Before US forces could reach him, Abu Ibrahim al-Hashemi al-Quraishi detonated a suicide bomb.

node.title: Virginia judge blocks governor's order allowing students to opt out of mask mandate
node.description: The governor's office says he will appeal the decision.

node.title: Who wants to be Auckland’s mayor?
node.description: While Aucklanders may only just be returning from sunning themselves on the beach, the race to become the city's next mayor is already heating up.

node.title: President Biden extends solar tariffs, with major caveats.
node.description: The Biden administration extended tariffs on imported solar products but made changes to exempt many more products from the levies, a decision that angered some domestic producers.

node.title: Ahmaud Arbery killer withdraws guilty plea in federal hate crimes trial
node.description: The withdrawal comes days after a U.S. District Court judge rejected terms of a plea deal between defense attorneys and prosecutors that was met with passionate objections by Arbery's parents.

node.title: Pence says "Trump is wrong" that he could have overturned election
node.description: The idea that any president could choose the country's leader is "un-American," former Vice President Mike Pence said.

node.title: Highlights of first women's Cricket World Cup in 1973
node.description: Forty-nine years after the first women's Cricket World Cup, New Zealand is about to host the tournament. Jimmy Ellingham speaks to members of the 1973 team about their memories on and off the field. Video

node.title: Who was Balin Stewart, and why has his death sparked a movement?
node.description: Sunshine Coast Stadium was a sea of people in white shirts this week — a solemn tribute to another beloved young person who had lost their life to something preventable.

node.title: Jeff Bezos' superyacht will see historic bridge dismantled
node.description: The middle section of Rotterdam's Koningshaven Bridge will be temporarily removed to allow the Amazon founder's 130ft (40m) high boat to sail through.

node.title: Covid-19 booster shots in big demand: 'People itching to get it'
node.description: Vaccinators around the country are reporting a rush on Covid-19 vaccinations with an additional one million New Zealanders now eligible for a third dose.

node.title: Historic flag pole in Russell vandalised, seriously damaged
node.description: The historic flagpole on Te Maiki Hill in Russell has been damaged and the surrounding area has been graffitied. It's been closed while work is underway to restore it.

node.title: Pentagon releases report on servicemembers killed in Kabul in August
node.description: The August attack took place in the closing days of the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan.

node.title: Opposition parties take contrasting views on border re-opening plan
node.description: The government's plan to re-open the border, allowing people to bypass what the prime minister has described as "the anguish of MIQ", is being shot down by the opposition as both too slow and too…

node.title: A surprising jobs report gives Washington an easier talking point.
node.description: The Fed was preparing to navigate its path toward higher interest rates amid Omicron disruptions. Unexpectedly, hiring held up.

node.title: Farm Aid says "Made in USA" beef may come from Brazil
node.description: Organization behind annual benefit concerts urges support for bipartisan legislation to help American cattle ranchers.

node.title: 20 people arrested for using drones to deliver contraband to South Carolina prison
node.description: Authorities seized knives, guns, meth, tobacco and crack cocaine.

node.title: Pennsylvania Doctor Accused of Prescribing Ivermectin for Covid Is Fired
node.description: Tower Health Medical Group said in a statement that it learned of the allegations on Wednesday. After an investigation, the doctor’s employment was “terminated effective immediately.”

node.title: Meet the U.S. Figure Skating Team
node.description: Figure skating events began even before Beijing’s opening ceremony. Here are the athletes I’ll be watching.

node.title: Michael Avenatti convicted of stealing from Stormy Daniels
node.description: It was another crushing defeat for the California lawyer, who has faced a host of legal problems.
